title: Louisa Cadamuro
summary: Louisa Nécib Cadamuro (French pronunciation: ​[luiza neˈsib]; born 23 January 1987) is a French former professional footballer who played for the France national team. She spent the majority of her career at Lyon, amassing eighteen titles with the French club over a nine-year span. She played as a attacking midfielder and was described as a "gifted playmaker" who "possesses superb technique".[2] Nécib is also known for her "elegant possession, sublime passing skills, and cultured touch on the ball".[3]
